qas.question: When did a post-punk revival start happening in England and the Colonies?
What early sign heralded the post-punk revival?
When did some of the darker post-punk bands start to appear in the indie scene?

answers.text: emergence of various underground bands in the mid-'90s

qas.question: Who were the most commercially successful bands of the post-punk revival?

answers.text: the Strokes, Franz Ferdinand, Interpol, Neils Children and Editors

qas.question: When did the commercially successful post-punk bands begin to hit the scene?
Which dark post-punk bands began to emmerge in the indie scene?

answers.text: Cold Cave, She Wants Revenge, Eagulls, the Soft Moon, She Past Away and Light Asylum

qas.question: When did post-punk music lose popularity?

plausible_answers.text: the Strokes, Franz Ferdinand, Interpol, Neils Children and Editors

qas.question: Which bands never found commercial success?

plausible_answers.text: the Rapture, Radio 4 and LCD Soundsystem
Cold Cave, She Wants Revenge, Eagulls, the Soft Moon, She Past Away and Light Asylum

qas.question: Which post-punk bands avoided darker style?
What subculture avoided darker post-punk bands the most?

context: At <b10_0>the <a0_0><a5_0>turn of the 21st century<b10_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>, a post-punk revival developed in British and American alternative and indie rock, which soon started appearing in other countries, as well. The earliest sign of a revival was the <a1_0><a6_0>emergence of various underground bands<a1_0/> in the mid-'90s<a6_0/>. However, the first commercially successful bands – <a7_0><b11_0>the Strokes, Franz Ferdinand, Interpol, Neils Children and Editors<b11_0/><a7_0/> – surfaced in the <a8_0>late 1990s to early 2000s<a8_0/>, as did several dance-oriented bands such as <b12_0>the Rapture, Radio 4 and LCD Soundsystem<b12_0/>. Additionally, some darker post-punk bands began to appear in the indie music scene in <a2_0>the 2010s<a2_0/>, including <a9_0><b13_0>Cold Cave, She Wants Revenge, Eagulls, the Soft Moon, She Past Away and Light Asylum<b13_0/><a9_0/>, who were also affiliated with the darkwave revival, as well as A Place to Bury Strangers, who combined early post-punk and shoegaze. These bands tend to draw a fanbase who are a combination of the <a3_0>indie music<a3_0/> subculture, older post-punk fans and the current <b14_0>goth<b14_0/> subculture. In the 2010s, <a4_0>Savages<a4_0/> played a music reminiscent of early British post-punk bands of the late '70s.
